title: Stuck in loop when trying to build docker container
body:
Following the install guide for docker, when I attempt to run `docker compose up -d --build` running `docker ps` showed the container was stuck in a boot loop. Removing the `-d` from the build I received this error

` ✔ Network fluxgym_default  Created                                                                                                                     0.1s
 ✔ Container fluxgym        Created                                                                                                                     0.1s
Attaching to fluxgym

fluxgym  | Traceback (most recent call last):

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/diffusers/utils/import_utils.py", line 943, in _get_module

fluxgym  |     return importlib.import_module("." + module_name, self.__name__)

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/lib/python3.10/importlib/__init__.py", line 126, in import_module

fluxgym  |     return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)

fluxgym  |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1050, in _gcd_import

fluxgym  |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1027, in _find_and_load

fluxgym  |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1006, in _find_and_load_unlocked

fluxgym  |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 688, in _load_unlocked

fluxgym  |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>", line 883, in exec_module

fluxgym  |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 241, in _call_with_frames_removed

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/diffusers/loaders/single_file.py", line 24, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from .single_file_utils import (

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/diffusers/loaders/single_file_utils.py", line 28, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from ..models.modeling_utils import load_state_dict

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/diffusers/models/modeling_utils.py", line 37, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from ..quantizers import DiffusersAutoQuantizer, DiffusersQuantizer

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/diffusers/quantizers/__init__.py", line 15, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from .auto import DiffusersAutoQuantizer

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/diffusers/quantizers/auto.py", line 22, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from .bitsandbytes import BnB4BitDiffusersQuantizer, BnB8BitDiffusersQuantizer

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/diffusers/quantizers/bitsandbytes/__init__.py", line 2, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from .utils import dequantize_and_replace, dequantize_bnb_weight, replace_with_bnb_linear

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/diffusers/quantizers/bitsandbytes/utils.py", line 32, in <module>

fluxgym  |     import bitsandbytes as bnb

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/bitsandbytes/__init__.py", line 15, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from .nn import modules

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/bitsandbytes/nn/__init__.py", line 21, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from .triton_based_modules import (

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/bitsandbytes/nn/triton_based_modules.py", line 7, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from bitsandbytes.triton.int8_matmul_mixed_dequantize import (

fluxgym  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/bitsandbytes/triton/int8_matmul_mixed_dequantize.py", line 12, in <module>

fluxgym  |     from triton.ops.matmul_perf_model import early_config_prune, estimate_matmul_time

fluxgym  | ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'triton.ops'
`

I inserted `triton` into the list of packages to be installed by `pip` in the Dockerfile. I ran `docker build --no-cache` to rebuild everything, and saw triton being installed in one of the steps. However I still receive the exact same error message, and I can't seem to find any answers on Google how to fix this. Any help would be appreciated.
author: gavanpang

comments.body: Can confirm having the same issue
having the same issue

fixed the issue by adding this after line 32 on DockerFile
  `RUN pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall triton==2.1.0`
thanks was facing same issue, works after adding triton.
Thank you for the solution, it's working now!

How to download
How to download

I had the same error after downloading and using the UI locally. 
Bug can be fixed by running (in terminal/bash)
export PATH="/PATH_TO_YOUR_ENVIRONMENT/bin:$PATH"

before running 
python app.py

title: torch.cpu.amp.autocast(args...)` is deprecated. Please use `torch.amp.autocast('cpu', args...)` instead.
body:
Was working fine yesterday. Now I can't seem to make it work

\checkpoint.py:1399: FutureWarning: `torch.cpu.amp.autocast(args...)` is deprecated. Please use `torch.amp.autocast('cpu', args...)` instead.
author: Iamausername1958

comments.body: same problem

Found another thread ( I should have checked before... sorry!) with that same problem. This was cocktailpeanut's answer: 


"I think this is a warning and not an error. Unless the process crashes it is still going.

Even I see this warning message but the training works fine. The reason it is not updating quickly is because the script seems to only print all the updates after each epoch (instead of each step).

This means it takes quite some time before the first progress is printed on the screen. So unless the program completely crashes and you don't see any VRAM usage on your task manager, try to keep it running and see if it updates."


Will run it overnight and update tomorrow as my GPU is indeed working in the back end! I wonder why it just stopped showing steps all of the sudden though.
just let it run and it will progress to the next step, I fixed the code and it still running like this so it doesn't matter.

I can confirm that it does work! Ignore the warning if it doesn't crash. 

Thanks everyone!

title: [Feature request] Server Port argument
body:
I found and read the #80 post, and I've gotten it to work on a custom port.


It seems like it would be a nice launch argument to add to the script, as a user-friendly way to not require people to set environment variables.

Using an environment variable doesn't make sense to me since this will not be the only gradio app I'm running, which is the reason why I'm looking to change the port.

I made it working like this:
```
app.py:
if __name__ == "__main__":
    cwd = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
    port = int(sys.argv[1]) if len(sys.argv) > 1 else 7860  # Default to 7860 if no port is provided
    demo.launch(debug=True, show_error=True, allowed_paths=[cwd], server_port=port)


In my launch.bat:
@echo off 
set PORT=7861
call venv\Scripts\activate
cmd /k "cd /d %~dp0 & call venv\Scripts\activate & python app.py %PORT%"
```

Just in case this helps anyone else.

But I still would love to just be able to set this in a user config so I wouldn't need to update project source files.
author: MNeMoNiCuZ

comments.body:
> try this:
> 
> ```
> //linux or mac
> export GRADIO_SERVER_PORT=5000
> or
> //windows in cmd
> set GRADIO_SERVER_PORT=5000
> ```
> 
> then run the app

Thanks for the tip.
But as mentioned in my post, I don't really want to set gradio server ports as I have other gradio apps running.
I just want to be able to customize the instance of this program in a friendly way, without modifying the original code.

> > try this:
> > ```
> > //linux or mac
> > export GRADIO_SERVER_PORT=5000
> > or
> > //windows in cmd
> > set GRADIO_SERVER_PORT=5000
> > ```
> > 
> > 
> >     
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >     
> >   
> > then run the app
> 
> Thanks for the tip. But as mentioned in my post, I don't really want to set gradio server ports as I have other gradio apps running. I just want to be able to customize the instance of this program in a friendly way, without modifying the original code.

This will not edit the code. Run in CMD or terminal before run the app.py.

Ah, great! That worked as a solution for me then.
Creating a .bat with this in it:

@echo off
set GRADIO_SERVER_PORT=5000
call venv\Scripts\activate
cmd /k "cd /d %~dp0 & python app.py"


Thanks @Semonxue <3

  File "K:\ComfyUI_windows_portable\fluxgym\app.py", line 625, in start_training

Got it. My accelerate.exe was not the the system path.
Hi @deepfree2023 can you please provide the exact steps you took to fix it ? I have the same issue.

+1
+1 @deepfree2023  @Shavalyoth
Hi, I just added my accelerate.exe path into the system path, and it worked. But not working efficiently, no partially loading into vram, the training speed was very very slow.

title: enable buckets
body: enable buckets is set to false in the script, can we please get a checkbox option for this.
author: zethfoxster

comments.body: All my images are different ratios and dimensions. Do I need to have buckets enabled? the default is off but didn't have a problem when I tried creating a LoRA a few weeks ago.

its cropping the images if you dont enable buckets and have a mix...which sometimes can end up cropping off faces, or key items in the images....this issue can be closed as he since added a method to edit that directly in the webui on the right side, you can just edit it to true.

@palvarez19
Do you get it when you try to start Flux?

Also please check if the unet model is present in `./fluxgym/models/unet`
the 2 clip models are in `./fluxgym/models/clip`

> @palvarez19 Do you get it when you try to start Flux? I installed it as well a few hours ago. It was starting on Windows 10. Also please check if the unet model is present in `./fluxgym/models/unet` the 2 clip models are in `./fluxgym/models/clip` and the vae model is in `./fluxgym/models/vae`

Yes, I doubled checked and all the files are in the right directories.
I reinstalled everything again, but specifying python3.10, like this: python3.10 -m venv env. Fluxgym ran after doing that.

title: Apply environ and path changes before other imports
body:
In `python 3.12` you need to modify the paths before the import happens or else the execution will fail complaining with the error `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'train_network'`, as referenced in issue #101 

In this PR I moved the environ and path changes to right after the `os` and `sys` imports. This makes the app launch successfully in `python 3.12`
author: diego-treitos

comments.body: Thank you, My bad!

> @ronbere, I thought the same but mine is working. Under task manager, what is the GPU memory usage saying?

Mine appears to be doing something with the GPU after this error but FluxGym does not tell me the estimated time of completion. I've had it running now for over 30 minutes and the last entry in the console was 30 minutes ago with that error. I've no idea how long this will take or if it's even doing anything productive or just using my GPU constantly because it's stuck.

EDIT: ok epoch 2 has kicked in. At least I can see the console is active.

> @ronbere, I thought the same but mine is working. Under task manager, what is the GPU memory usage saying?

GPU usage 27%
some problem starting after 25 min. very slow. update this

title: Command exited with code 1
body:
Maybe because it`s forced to use bf16 which is not supported by rtx20xx arch cards?
I have 16gb ram and 12gb vram and 1/2 of Quadro 6000(Turing Generation)

author: Telllinex

comments.body: Same here

Idk if author of fluxgym can really do anything about this error, i tried kohyass gui and the same error occurs…. 
I saw a lot of people complaining about kohyass broken repo with a lot of issues that only lucky ones can run it without issues :)
In previous comment I've seen there is a problem with pinokio install only.  Now I'm updating, but takes ages. It downloads the whole internet. 206 GB so far. ????

> In previous comment I've seen there is a problem with pinokio install only. Now I'm updating, but takes ages. It downloads the whole internet. 206 GB so far. ????

I rage deleted both kohya_ss and fluxgym and now successfully training in onetrainer without any issue on 12gb vram)
I guess both kohya and fluxgym is so fragile to a lot of aspects it is not worth waiting for help and waisting time to install and fix everything)

title: do we need to use Q8 gguf for 12gb gpu ?
author: l33tx0

comments.body: No, I've trained 3 Loras so far with this tool on my 12 GB card, with 1024x1024 source pics, and without needing to change the model.
